-1.title: Episode dated 15 January 2017
-1.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

1.title: Fall Feast on the Farm
1.plot: Nancy Fuller picks up some fresh lamb from a friend's sheep farm and prepares a fall feast, consisting of stew with sherry and mushrooms, plus roasted russet wedges with balsamic vinegar and rosemary in the premiere of the cooking show.

2.title: Square Dance in the Barn
2.plot: Nancy hosts a square dance in her barn, serves a feast of local food and decorates with flowers she picked in Craryville, N.Y. Recipes include two- meat chili; zippy scallion cornbread; bread pudding with bourbon sauce; and a special punch.

3.title: Old-Fashioned Dinner Party
3.plot: Nancy hosts an old-fashioned Dutch dinner party in her 1650s home. The menu features roasted chicken with chestnut breading, sweet corn pudding and, for dessert, a rustic fruit tart. Plus, she makes a spicy mulled wine.

4.title: Romance at 2000 Feet
4.plot: Nancy surprises her husband on their wedding anniversary with a ride in a hot-air balloon. She also prepares a scrumptious meal featuring filet mignon sandwiches and a salad made of kale and Brussels sprout. Plus, there's a carrot cake.

5.title: Canning Party (Ladies Who Can)
5.plot: Nancy picks apples for a canning party she's hosting. On the menu: hearty butternut squash soup; spiced apple butter; lemon-and-sugar mini biscuits; orange tea with honey.

6.title: Weekend with the Grandkids
6.plot: Nancy spends the weekend with her grandchildren. On the menu: grilled meatloaf sandwiches; potato salad; and a berry fruit cobbler with fresh whipped cream.

7.title: Episode #1.7
7.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

1.title: Antique Hunt
1.plot: Nancy searches her favorite antique shops for old kitchen gadgets. Then, she uses her finds to make a meal of chile-braised ribs, served with stove-top macaroni and cheese. For dessert, baked madeleines with cinnamon and sugar.

2.title: Game Night In
2.plot: Nancy purchases wine for a dinner-and-games night. On the menu: beef Wellington; a roasted-beet salad with walnuts and goat cheese; baked Alaska.

3.title: Poker Night with Aunt Jean
3.plot: Nancy hosts a poker night for her aunt, who's visiting from Las Vegas. On the menu: chorizo quesadillas with easy homemade salsa; buffalo-shrimp skewers; pomegranate guacamole; and sparkling vodka margaritas.

4.title: Early Birds
4.plot: A Mother's Day breakfast features buttermilk pancakes with blueberry syrup; a sausage-spinach-potato tart; citrus salad with pistachios and honey vinaigrette; and Bloody Marias with bacon-wrapped cornichons.

5.title: L.O.L.(Lots of Leftovers)
5.plot: Nancy makes dinner from the previous day's leftovers. On the menu: a fried chicken BLT melt; tomato-vegetable-rice soup; and cheesecake balls.

6.title: Operation: Farm Fresh
6.plot: Nancy hosts a welcome-home party for her nephew and his service buddies, who have just gotten back from Afghanistan. She cooks up an all-American home-cooked meal, consisting of fried pork chops, braised kale and tomatoes.

7.title: Grill Marks the Spot
7.plot: A cookout menu features grilled banana boats, rib eye crusted with salt and pepper, and a garlicky green salad. Also: Nancy makes creamy orange-soda floats for her guests to enjoy as they release flying lanterns into the sky.

8.title: Drive-In Date Night
8.plot: A date night at the drive-in movie theater includes a meal that harks back to Nancy's teenage years. On the menu: a cola milkshake with cherry whipped cream; double-patty cheeseburgers with Nancy's special sauce; and spicy curly fries.

9.title: Fuller Farm Fest
9.plot: Nancy celebrates owning her home for 20 years by inviting her friends over for some farm games and food. On the menu: beer-braised beef; roasted garlic mashed potatoes; buttered peas; and sundaes topped with homemade caramel-bourbon sauce.

10.title: B-I-N-G-O
10.plot: Nancy prepares food for a night of bingo with her friends. On the menu: farro salad with radishes, arugula and feta; pork loin; corn chowder; and a braided strawberry tart.

11.title: Fly Fishing
11.plot: Nancy spends the day fly-fishing with her son. Later, she takes what they caught and prepares a dinner, consisting of bacon-wrapped trout, asparagus with a creamy herb vinaigrette, and peanut-butter cookies.

12.title: Dance-a-Thon
12.plot: Nancy helps raise money for her favorite charity by hosting a dance marathon in her barn. Among the dishes she serves: a pasta salad made with eggplant and sausage; green beans with bacon; a glazed Clementine pound cake; and pink lemonade.

13.title: Bailey's Birthday
13.plot: Nancy prepares to celebrate her granddaughter Bailey's 7th birthday with a petting zoo and a menu consisting of chicken Parmesan sticks, roasted broccoli with cheddar sauce, and a vanilla cake with chocolate frosting.

1.title: Aunt Jean Is Back in Town
1.plot: Nancy prepares, for her visiting aunt, a special meal of fish and chips, served with a tangy tartar sauce and a side of succotash. Also: homemade bitters are used when making a honey-pear icebox trifle with soft ginger snaps.

2.title: Camp Gigi
2.plot: Nancy invites all 13 of her grandkids to the farm for a week of food and fun, culminating with a campfire and traditional crab-and-shrimp boil. Dishes include new potatoes; creamed corn; banana pudding with homemade vanilla wafers; and a punch made of sparkling apple cider.

3.title: Farm Girl Meets City Boy
3.plot: Nancy caters a golf tournament at the country club where she first met her husband. On the menu: prime rib sandwiches with horseradish sauce; sweet-potato steak fries; gopher bars; and a special "Back Nine" cocktail.

4.title: School Garden
4.plot: Nancy prepares a meal, for local students, using ingredients they grew in a school garden. On the menu: pasta primavera w/ handmade linguine; herb-buttered corn on the cob; zesty vegetable-and-bread salad; s'mores-chocolate-chip cookies.

5.title: Bake Fest
5.plot: Nancy prepares for a bake sale festival on the farm. Included: she bakes a batch of her famous golden biscuits; picks strawberries for a lattice-topped rhubarb pie; and makes BLTAs with avocado; Neapolitan cupcakes and slushies.

6.title: Adventure on the Hudson
6.plot: A picnic along the Hudson River features grilled striped bass with fire-roasted onions and peppers, German potato salad, and grilled banana pound cake with chocolate sauce.

7.title: Murder Mystery Farmhouse Dinner
7.plot: Nancy celebrates Halloween by hosting a murder mystery dinner at the farmhouse. On the menu: garlicky chicken Parmesan; a green broccoli soup served in a cauldron; blood-red-velvet cake; and hemlock cocktails.

8.title: The Fed Baron
8.plot: Nancy prepares a picnic for her family to enjoy at an air show. On the menu: Waldorf chicken-salad sandwiches; apple-and-pear fruit salad with honey-lime vinaigrette; and airplane sugar cookies with royal icing.

9.title: A Hunting She Will Go
9.plot: Nancy prepares duck cacciatore, using freshly hunted fowl. The menu also includes cheesy artichoke dip with grilled toasts; cheesy mashed potatoes; and a rustic ginger-plum tart.

10.title: Farmhouse Thanksgiving
10.plot: Nancy hosts Thanksgiving dinner for her family. On the menu: roasted turkey with herb gravy; oyster stuffing; green-bean casserole; and pumpkin cakes, made with eggs from her daughter-in-law's chicken coop.

11.title: Hudson Valley Bounty
11.plot: Nancy prepares a dinner to share w/her farming community. On the menu: pork pot roast w/root vegetables; sweet greens w/maple vinaigrette; super-easy dinner rolls; and cheesy potato gratin made w/milk and cheese from a local daily farmer.

12.title: Fabric of a Farm Town
12.plot: Nancy invites her best friends over to work on a community quilt. For lunch, she prepares classic rosemary lamb chops; twice-baked potatoes; sautéed garlic broccoli rabe; and black-and-white-dipped homemade shortbread.

13.title: Home for the Holidays
13.plot: Nancy prepares a holiday feast for her family, featuring all of their favorite dishes. The menu includes a prime rib roast with red wine au jus; broccoli-and-cauliflower gratin; Yorkshire pudding popovers; gingerbread with cranberry curd.

1.title: Hoppy and Happy
1.plot: Nancy visits a brewery and prepares a meal that includes beer-braised beef chuck stew and fudge cake with stout glaze. Also: she uses ale to make cheddar biscuits and a special vinaigrette for her kale salad.

2.title: Bonfire Bonding
2.plot: Nancy invites her family over for an old-fashioned bonfire, during which she serves French onion soup in sourdough bread bowls. Also: a layered salad w/ pork chops and blue-cheese dressing, plus no-bake chocolate-toffee cookies for dessert.

3.title: A Farmer's Family Tree
3.plot: Nancy rediscovers her family history and prepares a special meal that includes ham soufflé, baked beans, French pickles, and molasses cookies with boiled marshmallow frosting.

4.title: The Root Cellar
4.plot: Fruits and vegetables are on the menu when Nancy makes ham steak with apple-mustard chutney; shredded beet-and-carrot salad; a scalloped veggie casserole; honey-ginger lemonade; and butterscotch pudding with chocolate ganache.

5.title: The Bowlerinas
5.plot: Nancy cooks brunch for her bowling team. On the menu: French toast stuffed with cream cheese; sausage-and-bacon hash; berry-granola parfait; and a special "Bowlerinas" punch.

6.title: The Auctionista
6.plot: Nancy attends an auction with a gal pal, followed by a lunch of poached salmon salad, herbed rice pilaf and asparagus with hollandaise. Also on the menu: a sweet pea springtime mimosa; and strawberry buckle with vanilla ice cream.

7.title: Bunkin' with Gigi
7.plot: Nancy cooks for her grandchildren. On the menu: sausage-stuffed zucchini boats; dressed-up grilled cheese; loaded baked potato soup; and sweet cherry pie with sprinkled ice cream scoops.

8.title: David's Surprise Party
8.plot: Nancy throws her husband, David, a surprise birthday party featuring his favorite Italian recipes, including fried Brussels sprouts with pancetta and goat cheese; spaghetti and lamb meatballs; chopped caprese salad; and lemon bars.

9.title: Jam-Packed Meal
9.plot: Nancy uses jam in recipes. Included: a sage-rubbed chicken with peach glaze; spinach salad; and roasted turnips. Also: a strawberry rhubarb parfait with frozen yogurt and toasted walnut brittle.

10.title: From Farmhouse to Firehouse
10.plot: Nancy prepares a spicy meal for the men and women who serve at the local firehouse. On the menu: three-meat chili; jalapeño cornbread; creamed kale with pearl onions; and fiery triple-chocolate cream pie.

11.title: Mother-Daughter Dinner Party
11.plot: A mother-daughter dinner party, hosted by Nancy, includes recipes for chicken liver mousse; welsh rarebit; beef bourguignon; Russian wedge salad; and crème brulee.

12.title: Artsy Appetizers
12.plot: Nancy makes appetizers for a cocktail party. Included: sausage-stuffed mushrooms; Roquefort-rolled grapes; oysters Rockefeller; seared beef tenderloin bites; and a cocktail dubbed the "Starving Artist".

13.title: Hudson 500, International Farmway
13.plot: Nancy grills a menu with a racing theme. Included: barbecue chicken sandwiches; fruit and vegetable kabobs; "victory lap" nachos; and a checkered flag cake for dessert.

1.title: Boxcar Beauties
1.plot: In the Season 5 premiere, Nancy shows her grandkids how to make fresh vegetable lasagna with spinach and zucchini; chicken taco pacos; crinkle-cut carrots and zesty herb dip; chocolatey creep critter bars.

2.title: Treasures in the Attic
2.plot: Nancy cleans the attic, with help from her granddaughters. Later, they eat homemade orange marmalade and hand-rolled grain crackers, creamed chipped beef, rainbow roasted vegetables and an upside-down cake, made with peaches and blueberries.

3.title: The Great Outdoors
3.plot: Nancy plans a hike and picnic-style lunch, which includes BBQ-braised brisket sandwiches, creamy coleslaw, deviled eggs and vanilla ice cream with wet walnuts.

4.title: Two Ladies on the Farm
4.plot: Nancy learns about soul food from her new friend, Kardea Brown. On the menu: salt-and-pepper biscuits with bacon butter; grilled shrimp and corn salad with herb-lime dressing; crawfish pie; caramel and cashew pull-apart bread with coffee ice cream; a Pimm's cup cocktail.

5.title: Fast Times on the Farm
5.plot: Nancy prepares a quick lunch for her friends. On the menu: hot-pressed Reubens with kicked-up Russian dressing; spicy tomato-and-cheddar soup; crispy lemon-garlic kale chips with creamy cool dip; blackberry-and-peanut-butter crumble.

6.title: Book Drive at the Barn
6.plot: Nancy hosts a book drive in her barn and serves some of her favorite catering classics, including creamy crab and bacon endive boats, chicken divan casserole, apple puffs with meringue, and milk punch.

7.title: Reunion on the Farm
7.plot: Nancy makes family favorites, including Farm-Style Chicken and Drop Dumplings, Big Leafy Green Salad with Goat Cheese Tarts, Banana Cream Pie with Graham Cracker Crust, plus Rhubarb Reunion Cocktail and Spritzer for Kids.

8.title: A Haunting in Hudson
8.plot: Nancy celebrates Halloween dressed as the Bride of Frankenstein and shares some haunted treats with the neighborhood children. On the menu: cheesy spider dip; bursting intestines; sweet pumpkin mousse; bloodshot buckeyes; and black death fizzes.

9.title: Alfresco on the Farm
9.plot: A romantic alfresco dinner includes the same foods that Nancy had on her first date with her husband, David. On the menu: crispy fried lamb chops with fresh mint jelly; shrimp scampi with bucatini noodles; bean salad with cream Caesar vinaigrette,

10.title: All Aboard the Farmhouse Express!
10.plot: Nancy prepares for a railroad ride and a special meal with visiting family. On the menu: honey-fried chicken; Cobb salad with bacon-buttermilk dressing; a chocolate-chip-cookie icebox cake; frozen basil lemonade; sweet and salty conductor corn.

11.title: A Nancy Fuller Thanksgiving
11.plot: Nancy offers time-saving tips, while preparing a Thanksgiving feast. On the menu: rolled turkey breast with nutty fruit stuffing; succotash; mashed potatoes with sour cream and fresh horseradish; pumpkin and apple pie.

12.title: Farmer's Feast
12.plot: Nancy hosts a dinner for farmers, who volunteer to promote agriculture in the New York area. On the menu: a dish called "Devils on the Water"; short-rib stew with port-and-horseradish creme; savory garlic scones with herb cheese spread.

13.title: A Farmer's Family Christmas
13.plot: A Christmas Eve celebration features recipes for crown roast of pork with chestnut-sausage stuffing; glazed carrots with marjoram; and cookies for Santa. Also: ice cream eggnog for the adults.

1.title: Spring Kick-Off
1.plot: Nancy hosts a good old-fashioned spring kick-off for her farmer friends in the Season 6 premiere. On the menu: strawberry jelly roll; spring greens salad with traditional ranch dressing; shepherd's pie with tater tot topping.

2.title: Cozy Food and Fun on the Farm
2.plot: Nancy prepares a hearty dinner for her son and his family. Included: a warm spinach-olive-and-artichoke dip; porky pot pie with cheesy drop biscuits; butter-roasted turnips; homemade hot chocolate with old-fashioned donut sticks for dunking.

3.title: Teaching Little Men to Cook 101
3.plot: Hostess Nancy Fuller teaches her grandson and a few of his friends how to cook. Recipes include foolproof chicken Parmesan; spaghetti and meatballs; sautéed green beans with creamy lemon dressing; peanut butter bars with salted chocolate ganache.

4.title: The Linen and Lace Tea Party
4.plot: Lorraine Pascale helps Nancy plan a tea party for her granddaughters. On the menu: salmon Wellingtons; broccoli salad with goat cheese; individual pistachio Bundt cakes with lemon curd filling; and bacon-cheddar straws.

5.title: Here's to Another 250 Years!
5.plot: Nancy Fuller's farmhouse is turning 250, so she invites her closest friends and family to celebrate. To toast another 250 years, she makes a Sparkling Stone Fence Cocktail, Bacon-Wrapped Pork Roast and Orange Ombre Birthday Cake.

6.title: If Leftovers Are Wrong, I Don't Want to Be Right
6.plot: Nancy cooks with leftovers. Recipes include a kitchen sink frittata; meatloaf soup; brownie bread pudding with coconut chunks; overnight cantaloupe eats; and a sweet vodka sipper.

7.title: Farmer's Fiesta
7.plot: Fiery Cuban food is prepared for a farmer's fiesta. Recipes include arroz con pollo; sweet and spicy baked plantain chips; kicked-up Cuban salad; cheese flan; and spicy mojitos.

8.title: Celebrating Mothers
8.plot: Nancy spends Mother's Day with her three granddaughters. On the menu: veal scallopini with mushroom marsala sauce; sautéed spinach with garlic and thyme; blueberry cobbler a la mode; and a sip-tastic spritz recipe.

9.title: Potluck Party
9.plot: Nancy Fuller hosts a ladies' weekend. On the menu: honey-braised leg of lamb with carrots and fennel; peppery Parmesan orzo; rustic cinnamon-and-sugar hand pies with cream cheese filling. Also: guest Kardea Brown demonstrates how to make okra soup with shrimp in the Gecchee tradition.

10.title: BBQ, Baseball and Big Appetites
10.plot: A menu of grilled favorites is prepared for little leaguers, with help from Food Network Star (2005) winner Eddie Jackson. Recipes include sweet and sticky barbecue beef ribs; creamed cornbread pudding; and fried ice cream with cereal crust.

11.title: Breakfast for Dinner
11.plot: Nancy cooks breakfast for dinner for her visiting grandkids. Included: gooey cinnamon buns with cream cheese icing; sausage pancakes; sweet potato hash with fried eggs; sweet strawberry and banana milk.

12.title: Putt Putt with the Papas
12.plot: Nancy cooks a special meal for a Father's Day putt putt golf event. On the menu: a surf and turf dinner of spicy lobster cakes with mango salsa and porterhouse steak. Other recipes include mile-high loaded baked potatoes; and a fun twist on tiramisu.

13.title: A Hudson Summer Party
13.plot: A summer party is hosted by Nancy Fuller at her home, where she serves corn dog bites with a strong yellow mustard, a shrimp boil, fresh pasta salad with basil vinaigrette, butterscotch and chocolate dipped frozen bananas with candied nuts and sprinkles. On the drink menu is a boozy Bloody Mary beer.

1.title: Sweet Times at the Fairground
1.plot: Nancy Fuller's grandchildren gear up for the annual cupcake competition at the fair; the grand-kids participate, for the first time, in the competition that Nancy and David host in memory of David's late father.

2.title: Motorcycle Mama!
2.plot: Nancy Fuller trades her apron for a leather jacket for her 25th year acting as chair for her local hospice's charity motorcycle rally; Nancy prepares a brown bag lunch for the whole gang.

3.title: Gigi's Thanksgiving
3.plot: Nancy Fuller's family gathers at the farmhouse for another Fuller thanksgiving; roasted and braised turkey with cognac gravy; root vegetable mash with thyme brown butter; pull-apart butter rolls; pecan pie; bourbon cranberry cocktails.

4.title: Canvas and Cocktails
4.plot: Nancy Fuller trades drinks in return for a painting lesson, during her friend's canvas and cocktails class; lemon and oregano chicken; orzo pilal salad; winter citrus tart with shortbread almond crust; Moscow Mule cocktails.

5.title: Fuller Holiday Spectacular
5.plot: Nancy Fuller hosts a holiday party; crab cakes with zesty herb tartar; marinated beef tenderloin skewers with horseradish cream; ultimate cheese fondue dip station; Grammy Calf's popcorn balls; Nancy enjoys a champagne tower.

6.title: Baby, It's Cold Outside
6.plot: Nancy Fuller and her husband, David Fuller, enjoy some time to themselves before their family arrives; penne with meaty ragu; three cheese and herb garlic bread; lemon ricotta cookies; an old fashioned with rye; David presents Nancy with a surprise.

7.title: Open House Brunch
7.plot: Nancy Fuller hosts brunch at an open house for all her friends; building a Bloody Mary bar; shrimp cocktail with a twist; country ham breakfast casserole with hash brown cakes; Nancy's can't-miss tips for entertaining.

8.title: Wholesome Harvest
8.plot: Nancy Fuller prepares a light and fresh menu for herself and her husband, David Fuller; a get-up-and-go smoothie; chicken veggie soup with beef-bone broth; salmon with maple Dijon glaze over lentils and roasted vegetable salad.

imdb.title: Farmhouse Rules
plot: 'Nancy Fuller' (qv) prepares recipes made with farm-fresh ingredients.::anonymous
